article.heading: Life
article.paragraph: Anthemius was one of the five sons of Stephanus of Tralles, a physician. His brothers were Dioscorus, Alexander, Olympius, and Metrodorus. Dioscorus followed his father's profession in Tralles; Alexander did so inAncient RomeRomeand became one of the most celebrated medical men of his time; Olympius became a notedRoman lawlawyer; and Metrodorus worked as aGrammarian (Greco-Roman world)grammarianin Constantinople.sfnp''EB''1878

He was said to have annoyed his neighbor Zeno in two ways: first, by engineering a miniature earthquake by sending steam through leather tubes he had fixed among thejoistsand flooring of Zeno's parlor while he was entertaining friends and, second, by simulatingthunderandlightningand flashing intolerable light into Zeno's eyes from a slightly hollowed mirror.sfnp''EB''1911In addition to his familiarity with steam, some dubious authorities credited Anthemius with a knowledge ofgunpowderor other explosive compound.sfnp''EB''1878
article.heading: Mathematics
article.paragraph: Anthemius was a capableGreek mathematicsmathematician. In the course of his treatise "OnBurning Glasses", intended to facilitate the construction of surfaces to reflect light to a single point, he described the string construction of theellipsesfnpBoyer1991193and assumed a property of ellipses not found inApollonius of Perga'sConics: the equality of the angles subtended at a focus by two tangents drawn from a point. His work also includes the first practical use of thedirectrix (conic section)directrix: having given the focus and a double ordinate, he used the focus and directrix to obtain any number of points on aparabola.sfnp''EB''1911This work was later known toMathematics in medieval IslamArab mathematicianssuch asBook of OpticsAlhazen.
Eutocius's commentary on Apollonius'sConicswas dedicated to Anthemius.sfnpBoyer1991193File:Hagia-Sophia-Laengsschnitt.jpgthumb200pxTheHagia Sophiain cross section.
article.heading: Architecture
article.paragraph: As an architect, Anthemius is best known for his work designing theHagia Sophia. He was commissioned withIsidore of MiletusbyJustinian Ishortly after the earlier church on the site burned down in 532 but died early on in the project. He is also said to have repaired the flood defenses atDara (Mesopotamia)Daras.
